questions.question: Are all test probes identified or traceable to part number, frequency, coil diameter, probe type (Array, Differential, Absolute, etc.) and whether the coil is shielded or not?
questions.guidance: Note: Type and frequency can be traceable via the part number.

questions.question: Is a magnetometer / residual field indicator available to check for demagnetization?
questions.guidance: Guidance: If no ferromagnetic components are being tested → NA.

questions.question: Does a procedure (general or specific) exist for the eddy current test?
questions.guidance: ("Procedure" can be a technique sheet, traveler, route card, or similar.)

questions.question: Does the procedure(s) provide traceability to the name and address of the testing facility?
Is the procedure approved by the responsible Level-3?
Does the procedure(s) have an identification number and an approval date?
Do the procedures require that all personnel are qualified/certified for the task and contractual requirements?
Are the types of records and the method for identifying the inspection status described?
Is there a method for controlling software/programming for automated processing equipment (if applicable)?
Does the written procedure contain at least the part number, material, and material designation of the part to be tested?
Are the equipment to be used for the test, including manufacturer and model, documented?
Are frequency, coil diameter, shielded/unshielded, type, and part number of the probes used listed?
questions.guidance: Guidance: Type and frequency can be traceable via part number.

questions.question: Are the test instrument settings (e.g., gain, offset, phase, etc.) documented?
Does the procedure include requirements for demagnetization of reference standards and workpieces?
questions.guidance: Guidance: If no ferromagnetic parts are tested → NA.

questions.question: Does the procedure use magnetic field indicators to verify demagnetization?
If residual magnetism is present, are parts demagnetized and retested?
Are customer acceptance criteria addressed or traceable?
Are the required standardization parameters documented (e.g., minimum notch amplitude, gate settings)?
Is the minimum signal-to-noise ratio specified?
Does the procedure contain sketches, photos, or diagrams of the inspection area coverage/orientation?
Which internal filter settings are used (e.g., high-pass, low-pass)?
Which external filter settings are used?
Are inspection index increments, scan speed, and coverage verification method specified?
Are the acceptance requirements for evaluating indications and the action for the part after inspection specified?
Is the system checked at the start of inspection, after 4 hours, at the end of the shift, at the end of the batch, or at the end of inspection?
Is the system checked when equipment/accessories are changed or when power supply changes occur?
If an equipment failure occurs: Is the equipment repaired/replaced and the entire batch retested?
Is there a method for controlling software/programming for automated processing (if applicable)?
Does the standardization meet the requirements of the technique?
Is the roughness of the standard such that the signal-to-noise ratio required by the customer is maintained?
Are the same scan parameters used on the test part as on the reference standard?
Do the probe ends have protection against scratches (e.g., Teflon tape), if specified by the customer?
questions.guidance: NA if the probe is not in contact with the surface.

questions.question: Does the lift-off distance (probe ↔ material) correspond to the standardization?
If Bolt-Hole/Encircling/ID-Coils are used: Is the fill-factor within ±10% of the reference standard?
Is the system checked at start-up, after changes, after 4 hours, at the end of the shift, at the end of the batch, or at the end of inspection?
For automated systems: Has the standardization been performed according to customer requirements?
The Hall Effect meters shall be calibrated at a minimum of three points in each dynamic range and each polarity in addition to zero?
The Hall Effect meters are calibrated at least semi-annually?
Is there evidence of compliance to the procedure and are records of this test on file and do they indicate that the calibration is current?
The Eddy Current instrument shall hold a calibration certificate or metrology verification?
The Eddy Current instrument shall be calibrated or checked by metrology at least annually?
Is there evidence of compliance to the procedure and are records of this test on file and do they indicate that the calibration / metrology certificate is current?
That documentation is available for all reference standards fabricated in accordance with Subscriber specifications or referenced standards?
For special standards, the standard is comparable to the component being inspected, including surface finish?
That manufacturing documentation of the reference standards shall be available for review?
That all standards are clearly identified as to material type, notch size, and depth, etc. or traceable to documentation with noted requirements?
The bearing reference standard shall be representative of the configuration being inspected, per technique/procedure?
That reference/calibration standards are stored and handled to prevent damage from mishandling, corrosion, pitting, etc.?
Is there evidence of compliance with the procedure and are the test results documented and acceptable?

Documentation: Have the required documents for the tested parts been provided (order, drawing, work order, process specification, internal procedures, lot/serial number, Technique Card, Traveler, inspection log)?
Is the part controlled under U.S. Export Control Regulations as declared by the Auditee?
questions.guidance: Guidance: A NO answer does not require an NCR

questions.question: Compliance
Is the inspector wearing vision correction as required?
questions.guidance: Guidance: The Auditor shall verify that corrective lenses were used if required.

questions.question: Are the parts to be tested clearly identified and traceable to the order/drawing?
Are appropriate customer-specific specifications and revisions used (according to contract)?
Do inspection documents contain traceability to part number / material identification?
Are process specification and revision available?
Are acceptance criteria and revision documented?
Is the correct sequence of operations maintained?
Did the inspector review the relevant specifications, technique sheets and procedures before the inspection?
Was the component checked for residual field before testing and, if necessary, demagnetized?
If ferromagnetic parts were tested: Was the reference standard demagnetized to ≤1 Gauss (with residual field indicator) before testing?
Does the equipment support the frequency ranges of the probes used?
Is the equipment capable of detecting all relevant discontinuities mentioned in the customer acceptance specifications?
Do the test probes meet customer requirements?
Were all parts clean before testing?
Were the parts tested according to the applicable procedure/technique sheet?
Was it ensured that after standardization no settings were changed that could affect test performance?
Were residual field strength measurements performed on bearings before testing?
If required, were all parts demagnetized before testing?
Was the reference standard, if ferromagnetic, demagnetized so that ≤1 Gauss was present when measured?
Is eddy current only performed on finished bearing components?
Was the scan increment used according to technique/procedure?
Was the test speed the same as during setup?
Were all equipment settings made during setup left unchanged during testing?
In case of failure: Was equipment repaired/replaced and the entire batch retested?
Were rejected parts with detected residual magnetism demagnetized and retested?
In case of faulty setup execution, was the entire batch retested after correction?
After testing a batch, was the reference standard retested for verification?
For repeatability, was the signal amplitude response observed as defined in the procedure?
If not: Were corrective actions taken and the batch retested?
Did the inspector correctly evaluate all indications and reject parts with relevant indications above limit value?
Were all rejectable indications marked on the component and/or documented?
Were all relevant documents traceable to the part?
Did the inspector understand the specific acceptance/rejection criteria?
Do the acceptance criteria correctly reflect the customer requirements?
If required: Was appropriate post-cleaning performed?
Were parts adequately protected against corrosion/damage after cleaning?
Were the inspection personnel certified at the level required for their activity?
Are all Level 1 personnel properly supervised by Level II/III personnel during ET operations?
Are symbols/markings used to indicate the inspection status (e.g., ET tested) on paper routing/traveler?
Were all test results correctly recorded and traceably assigned to the parts?
